item.title: When Does Path of Exile 2 Become Free to Play?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/when-does-path-of-exile-2-become-free-to-play/

Path of Exile 2, Grinding Games’ latest action RPG, was going to be a free-to-play title. However, you need to pay $30 to play the game in early access right now. So when does Path of Exile 2 actually become free-to-play? The short answer is when the developers decide to remove it from early access. 

When Does Path of Exile 2 Early Access End? 

Currently, there is no concrete end date for Path of Exile 2’s early access. However, the developers have provided an estimated period in the game’s FAQ section. The answer to how long the early access will run is “As long as needed, we expect at least 6 months.” 

According to the developers’ estimated window, Path of Exile 2 will seemingly become free to play by June 2025. However, this is not a confirmed window, and as the developers have stated, “as long as needed,” they could take longer or even finish earlier. 

At the moment, you must pay a minimum of $30 to play Path of Exile 2’s early access on Steam, Epic Games Store, PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S. Check out where to play the game in early access here. 

In other news, Path of Exile 2 has doubled the all-time player peak of the original game while being in early access. Also, check out the game’s cross-platform and cross-progression details. What are your thoughts on Path of Exile 2 taking 6 more months to become free-to-play?  Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

Before you head off, check out our guide on everything we know about Path of Exile 2. It’s full of helpful information, like the system requirements and more!

item.title: Croc Legend of the Gobbos Delayed To 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/croc-legend-of-the-gobbos-delayed-to-2025/

Developer Argonaut Games announced that the remaster for Croc Legend of the Gobbos has been delayed into 2025. The game was originally scheduled to be released in December 2024.

In a message posted online, Argonaut said that game will now launch in Q1 2025.

“After careful consideration, we have decided to push the launch into Q1 2025,” they said. “This decision was not made lightly, but we believe that a little more time is needed to add the final touches to ensure the game meets the high standards that we aspire to and which you deserve.”

The statement continues by acknowledging that the news is “disappointing” for players to hear. The team wanted to make sure, however, that the game had the “quality and polish” it needs for release.

“[Our] goal has always been to deliver a game with the quality and polish that will truly delight,” they said. “We appreciate your patience and support as we work to bring Croc back in the best possible way.”

Despite the game’s delay, Argonaut seems excited about the return of the franchise. In a reply to a fan on Twitter on Sunday, they teased more Croc remasters, including Croc 3, should the first game do well when it launches.

“We’ve already stated that if the Croc remasters do well, we’d like to make Croc 3,” they said.

item.title: EA FC 25 Servers Status Check—Is EA FC 25 Down?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ea-fc-25-servers-status-check-is-ea-fc-25-down/

EA FC 25’s servers are unpredictable at best. It doesn’t matter how good your internet connection and speed are, if the servers don’t want to play ball (literally), then there’s nothing you can do. So let’s update you with the latest EA FC 25 server status changes.

It’s happened to us at all at some point. You’re ready for an epic EA FC 25 sesh with epic tactics at the ready, and you’re met with an “unable to connect to the EA servers” screen. EA FC 25 servers are not immune to this most frustrating issue, and I wish I could give it a red card.

We don’t need VAR to help us crack the mystery of EA FC 25’s server status though. There are a few ways to monitor the soccer title’s online servers and keep up with their latest developments.

Are EA FC 25 Servers Down?

Right now, EA FC 25 servers are not down, and they are fully operational and running without a hitch.

Our latest personal check of the EA FC 25 servers is happening now on Dec. 9, 2024. It’s not always easy to keep track of these things though, so, I’ve come up with a multitude of ways you can use to keep an eye on the EA FC 25 servers.

How to Check EA FC 25 Server Status

You can use EA’s official help page, track EA’s X social media communications and EA Help channels, and keep up with people’s real-life experiences of the EA FC 25 servers for the latest information.

EA FC 25 Server Help Page

The EA Help site has tons of different answers for technical questions related to the company’s various games. One of its main uses is the live service check which tracks the online connectivity status of online EA titles.

It includes the EA App and EA Play, along with a bunch of games: Apex Legends, Battlefield 2042, EA SPORTS College Football 25, EA FC 24, EA FC 25, FIFA 23, Madden NFL 24, Madden NFL 25, NHL 24, NHL 25, STAR WARS Battlefront II, The Sims 4, and EA SPORTS UFC 5.

I would be remiss to mention this crucial line on the page though: “We update this page as quickly as possible when a server goes down, but there might be delays.” Even though this is a handy source, there are other ways of checking the EA FC 25 servers we need to consider.

EA Help & EA Sports FC Communications on X

Social media site X has two different pages I think are useful for monitoring EA FC 25’s server status issues: EA Help and EA SPORTS FC Direct Communication.

EA Help is recommended by EA itself as a more up-to-date page that has the chance of being refreshed quicker than the main Server Help page.

Whereas EA SPORTS FC Direct Communication is a more general way of talking to the player base. Depending on the server status and major outages, it’s always handy to have, just in case.

People like ourselves are as relatable as anyone. If the servers are down and affecting me, there’s a good chance I’m going to complain about it. Many players take to different forms of social media to complain—inadvertently giving a live update on the situation.

This is why I’m pushing you to bookmark the EA Sports FC Reddit, as well as the Discord server. If you ignore the complaint posts about EA FC 25, there’s a lot of helpful information on these boards!

How has your experience been with the EA FC 25 servers this year? Have you played silky, slick football with no issue? Or is it like running around a wet, muddy pitch? While you think about this, be sure to read the best EA FC 25 Career Mode potential superstars to sign.
